common_issues.title: Suspicious Connections Reported on macOS with Pieces OS 4.3.4
common_issues.description: A user on macOS running Pieces OS 4.3.4 reports suspicious connection attempts detected by Warp Bot and flagged by Apple.  The user, an IT professional, has experienced persistent attacks requiring frequent factory restores over the past four years.  They've shared a Warp Bot report and suspect a compromised kernel despite restores.  They request Pieces OS be excluded as a potential source of the suspicious connections.

related_issues.title: Suspicious Connections
related_issues.text:
Suspicious Connections
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I’m experiencing frequent and sophisticated attacks on my machine. I’ve reported the issues to Apple using Warp Bot reports, but the device detects “suspicious connections.” I’d like to exclude your software since it’s beneficial for developers, but the attacks are persistent.

I’ve included Warp Bot’s findings and sent them to Apple’s security team. 

The bot has also prepared a report for the suspicious connections utilizing your software

[PIECES_OS_GITHUB_ISSUE_PUBLIC.md](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22247971/PIECES_OS_GITHUB_ISSUE_PUBLIC.md)

I should mention the kernel on my machine is compromised and this is after a factory restore and wiping of the hard drives. It's an ongoing issue, but wanted to alert you as best I could

. I suspect attackers exploited vulnerabilities in the past, leading to frequent factory restores every two to three months for the past four years. As an IT professional, I know what to look for, but these attacks have made me rethink my defenses. Despite this, I’m doing my best to protect my home network from such attacks.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate the "Suspicious Connections Reported on macOS with Pieces OS 4.3.4" issue, focusing on the user's Warp Bot report and the potential for Pieces OS to be involved.
Prioritize resolving issue #854 ("Suspicious Connections") due to its high activity level and potential security implications.
Given the recurrence of suspicious connection issues and the user's experience with compromised kernels, consider enhancing security measures within Pieces OS, particularly for macOS.
Develop a process for efficiently handling and investigating reports involving potential security vulnerabilities or exploits.
Improve communication with users experiencing security issues, providing clear updates and guidance on mitigation steps.
